snippet: In a re-creation of a legendary 1960 art event, the dealer Dominique Lévy has arranged a performance of Yves Klein’s “Monotone-Silence” Symphony.
abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column; artist Yves Klein's Monotone-Silence Symphony will be performed in New York to celebrate opening of art dealer Dominique Levy's art gallery; Whitney museum will present exhibit Rituals of Rented Island: Object Theater, Loft Performance, and the New Psychodrama--Manhattan, 1970-1980; Guggenheim’s UBS Map Global Art Initiative appoints curator Pablo Leon de la Barra as its curator for Latin America.
lead_paragraph: In a re-creation of a legendary 1960 art event, the dealer Dominique Lévy has arranged a performance of Yves Klein’s “Monotone-Silence” Symphony.

headline.main: Yves Klein’s ‘Monotone’ Symphony Is Headed to New York
headline.print_headline:
An Artist’s Symphony
Will Reverberate Again
